question: 4 (a)
sols_html:
Following the hints, we slice this “horn” into circular pieces. The volume of each slice is equal to \(\pi r^2 \ \Delta x\) where \(r\) is the radius of the circle and \(\Delta x\) is its thickness. Hence, in the limit \(\Delta x\to 0,\)

\[\begin{aligned} V_1&=\int_0^1 \pi (f(x)-1)^2 dx \\ &= \pi\int_0^1 (e^x-1)^2 dx\\ &=\pi\int_0^1 (e^{2x}-2e^x+1) dx\\ &=\pi\left[\frac{e^{2x}}{2}-2e^x+x\right]_0^1 \\ &=\pi\left(\frac{e^{2}}{2}-2e+1-\frac{e^{0}}{2}+2e^0-0\right) \\ &=\pi\left(\frac{e^{2}}{2}-2e+1-\frac{1}{2}+2\right) \\ &=\pi\left(\frac{e^{2}}{2}-2e+\frac{5}{2}\right) \end{aligned}\]
sols_latex:
Following the hints, we slice this ``horn'' into circular pieces. The
volume of each slice is equal to $\pi r^2 \ \Delta x$ where $r$ is the
radius of the circle and $\Delta x$ is its thickness. Hence, in the
limit $\Delta x\to 0,$

\begin{align*}
V_1&=\int_0^1 \pi (f(x)-1)^2 dx \\
&= \pi\int_0^1  (e^x-1)^2 dx\\
&=\pi\int_0^1  (e^{2x}-2e^x+1) dx\\
&=\pi\left[\frac{e^{2x}}{2}-2e^x+x\right]_0^1 \\
&=\pi\left(\frac{e^{2}}{2}-2e+1-\frac{e^{0}}{2}+2e^0-0\right) \\
&=\pi\left(\frac{e^{2}}{2}-2e+1-\frac{1}{2}+2\right) \\
&=\pi\left(\frac{e^{2}}{2}-2e+\frac{5}{2}\right) 
\end{align*}

statement_html:
Consider the function \(f(x)=e^x\) for 0 \(\leq\) x \(\leq\) 1.

Find the volume \(V_1\) of the horn when rotating \(f(x)\) around a horizontal axis at \(y=1\).
